paper_abstract: Given a list of d-dimensional cuboid items with associated profits, the orthogonal knapsack problem asks for a packing of a selection with maximal profit into the unit cube. We restrict the items to hypercube shapes and derive a (5/4 + epsilon) -approximation for the two-dimensional case. In a second step we generalize our result to a (2d+1/.2d + epsilon)-approximation for d-dimensional packing.
paper_title: Approximating the orthogonal knapsack problem for hypercubes
